doc.title: Guidelines on Making Communications Products and Activities Diverse and Inclusive

clauses.clause: These guidelines support the Government of Canada’s efforts to promote inclusion and respect for diversity and are intended to support departments when planning and developing communications products and activities. A communications product is any product produced by or on behalf of the Government of Canada that informs the public about policies, programs, services and initiatives, as well as dangers or risks to health, safety or the environment. Communications products can also aim to explain the rights, entitlements and obligations of individuals.
These guidelines are intended for all Government of Canada departments subject to the Policy on Communications and Federal Identity.

These guidelines support the Government of Canada’s commitment to implement Gender-based Analysis (GBA) Plus across federal departments and agencies. GBA Plus helps to ensure that federal government policies, programs and other initiatives are responsive, inclusive and reflective of diverse experiences and realities in order to address inequities and barriers.
These guidelines apply to communications products and activities for both internal and external audiences.

chapter.title: Guidelines
chapter.p: These guidelines outline considerations related to sex, gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disability, religion or any other identity factors, and are intended to help departments create diverse and inclusive communications products and activities.

clauses.clause: Use a variety of research sources to examine the barriers and inequalities of diverse populations in order to help inform the development of communications products;
Consult media monitoring and/or public environment analysis teams to obtain relevant media scans on target audiences; and
Consult with departmental or government-wide working groups with expertise in diversity and inclusion.
Consult with internal resources with relevant expertise to ensure content accurately reflects diverse perspectives and lived experiences; and
Apply the principles of plain language writing and inclusive communication.

clause.p: Ensure diversity is considered when showcasing various audiences by:

clauses.clause: Using a range of images/illustrations that are reflective of Canada’s diverse population;
Using accurate images and avoiding stereotypes;
Balancing representation of groups based on race, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, age, etc.;
Using images that represent different types of family units, people with physical differences and disabilities;
Consult with internal resources with relevant expertise to ensure images are culturally appropriate and reflect the intended audiences;
Build an inventory of photos and images that reflect a diverse population and consider sharing it with other communications teams across the Government of Canada; and
Ensure accurate representation of target audiences when using stock imagery.
Evaluate the effectiveness of communications products and activities and share relevant findings with the broader communications community.
